body_content.explanation: the fact of being able to be used or to do something:
examples: Chips manufactured before 2000 were reaching the limit of operability.
Normal wear and tear includes cosmetic damage which does not impair the operability of the item.

body_content.explanation: the fact of being able to be operated on:
examples: The lesion was able to be identified and an assessment of operability made.
Since surgery offers the only reasonable chance of a cure, many researchers have explored ways to increase operability.
